strategy: Apply a random forest regressor with feature importance-based feature selection: Extract all numerical features, perform a random forest regression to compute feature importance, and retain only the top 30% of features by importance. This reduces overfitting and captures non-linear relationships without assuming linearity. Train on the full dataset and evaluate R2 on a held-out validation set.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectKBest, f_regression
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']

# Handle missing values: fill with median for numerical, mode for categorical
numerical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numerical columns with median
X_train[numerical_cols] = X_train[numerical_cols].fillna(X_train[numerical_cols].median(numeric_only=True))
X_val[numerical_cols] = X_val[numerical_cols].fillna(X_val[numerical_cols].median(numeric_only=True))
test_df[numerical_cols] = test_df[numerical_cols].fillna(test_df[numerical_cols].median(numeric_only=True))

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
for col in categorical_cols:
    mode_val = X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown'
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].fillna(mode_val)
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(mode_val)

# Encode categorical variables using one-hot encoding
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, drop_first=True)
X_val = pd.get_dummies(X_val, drop_first=True)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, drop_first=True)

# Align columns (ensure same feature set)
X_train, X_val, test_df = X_train.align([X_val, test_df], join='outer', axis=1)

# Feature selection using Random Forest
